docs.title: Documentation
docs.description: Comprehensive guides and API documentation for the 4A User Center platform.
docs.apiDesc: Interactive API documentation with Swagger UI
docs.oauthDesc: Learn how to integrate OAuth 2.0 authentication
docs.featureFastDesc: Redis-powered caching with millisecond response times
docs.featureMultiDesc: Support for WeChat, DingTalk, and more
docs.featureAbacDesc: Fine-grained access control for flexible scenarios
docs.apiPageDesc: Interactive API documentation powered by Swagger UI. Explore all available endpoints and test them directly.
docs.oauthGuideDesc: Learn how to integrate OAuth 2.0 authentication with your application.
docs.oauthOverviewText1: OAuth 2.0 is the industry-standard protocol for authorization. It allows third-party applications to obtain limited access to user accounts without exposing user credentials.
docs.oauthOverviewText2: Our platform supports the Authorization Code flow, which is the most secure and recommended flow for server-side applications.
docs.oauthRegisterText: Before using OAuth, you need to register your application to obtain client credentials.
docs.step1Desc: Contact the platform administrator to request OAuth client registration.
docs.step2Desc: Provide your application's callback URL for receiving authorization codes.
docs.step3Desc: You will receive a client_id and client_secret for API authentication.
docs.oauthFlowText: The OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow involves the following steps:
docs.flow1Desc: Redirect user to the authorization endpoint with required parameters.
docs.flow2Desc: User authenticates and grants permission to your application.
docs.flow3Desc: Exchange authorization code for access token at token endpoint.
docs.flow4Desc: Use access token to access protected user resources.
docs.miniprogramGuideDesc: Integrate WeChat and DingTalk miniprogram login with your application.
docs.mpOverviewText1: Our platform provides seamless miniprogram login integration for WeChat and DingTalk platforms.
docs.mpOverviewText2: The integration flow is simplified: your miniprogram obtains an auth code and sends it to our backend for verification.
docs.mpWechatText: WeChat miniprogram uses wx.login() to obtain a temporary login code, which is then sent to your backend for verification.
docs.mpDingtalkText: DingTalk miniprogram uses dd.getAuthCode() to obtain an auth code for backend verification.
docs.wxStep1Desc: Call wx.login() to obtain a temporary login code.
docs.wxStep2Desc: Send the code to your backend server via HTTPS request.
docs.wxStep3Desc: Backend verifies the code and returns access tokens.
docs.dtStep1Desc: Call dd.getAuthCode() to obtain the authorization code.
docs.dtStep2Desc: Send the auth code to your backend server.
docs.dtStep3Desc: Backend verifies and returns user tokens.
docs.mpApiText: Use the following endpoints to handle miniprogram authentication:
docs.mpLoginDesc: Authenticate miniprogram user with provider code
docs.mpBindDesc: Bind miniprogram account to existing user
